definition: eyesight/strength of vision/the ability to make discerning judgments
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: This vision who can see people straight face?
sentences.chinese: 誰有這眼力能從面部直看到人心？

sentences.english: He is a truly perceptive critic.
sentences.chinese: 他確是一位很有眼力的批評家。

sentences.english: But for someone who has a vision it is easier to get exactly what you want.
sentences.chinese: 但對有眼力的人來說，卻更容易得到他真正所需要的。

sentences.english: If this analysis is not wrong, then that Wang's very discerning.
sentences.chinese: 如果這個分析不誤，那麼，可以認爲王氏極有眼力。

sentences.english: Daniel, now I want to test your vision.
sentences.chinese: 大牛，我現在要考考你的眼力了。

sentences.english: Botox is marketed in the United States by Allergan Inc. , of Irvine, Calif.
sentences.chinese: 在美國，肉毒桿菌由眼力健公司銷售。

sentences.english: I believe that all teachers of discernment .
sentences.chinese: 我相信所有老師們的眼力。

sentences.english: You have good taste . It's in style this year.
sentences.chinese: 您真是好眼力，這是今年流行的樣式。

sentences.english: There are 10 differences hidden in the two pictures. Can you find them?
sentences.chinese: 考考你的眼力，你能在這兩幅圖中找出10處不同嗎？

sentences.english: She has an eye for detail.
There is industry jargon Python, called two-thirds of the eye, in the hands of seven.
sentences.chinese: 微雕界有句行話，叫三分在眼力，七分在手上。

sentences.english: Old Mr Black loved shooting bears, but his eyes were not good any more.
sentences.chinese: 布萊克老先生酷愛獵熊，只是他的眼力已經不濟事了。

sentences.english: You're made a good choice. This china tea set is unusual.
sentences.chinese: 您真是好眼力，這種茶具不同尋常。

sentences.english: The pilot has a good eye for distances .
sentences.chinese: 這個飛行員的眼力很好，能望得很遠。

sentences.english: This old man has an eye for curios.
sentences.chinese: 這個老大爺有辨別古董的眼力。

definition: a mistake/an oversight/an error of judgment
to weigh up sb's words and observe their facial expression (idiom)/to discern what sb thinks from his body language
to believe (sth in relation to oneself)/to regard oneself as/to acknowledge (sth in relation to oneself)/to resign oneself to
